description: From Italian arioso (“airy, breezy”) (from aria (“air; aria, song”) (from Ancient Greek ᾱ̓ήρ (āḗr, “air; wind”), possibly ultimately from Proto-Indo-European *h₂ews- (“dawn; east”)) + -oso)  +‎ -ose.

adjectives.description: ariose (comparative more ariose, superlative most ariose)

examples: Much easy-listening music is light and ariose.
